title: News: Bowie announces The Next Day, his first album in a decade
content:
I thought I’d come out of the woodwork to post this gem, especially as its the first and probably last time I’ll ever write this sentence.

David Bowie has announced a new album whilst you were sleeping. Today marks the glam rock troubadour’s 66th birthday and The Next Day will be the first new album in ten years.

According to the announcement by Iso/Columbia records in the early hours of this morning, Bowie’s new album will be entitled The Next Day, available as a pre-order on iTunes with a wider release scheduled for March. It’ll be his 30th studio album of his long, colourful yet often elusive career.

The single, Where Are We Now?, was written by Bowie, recorded in New York and produced Tony Visconti. The accompanying video directed by Tony Oursler recalls Bowie’s time living in Berlin. He is seen looking in on vintage footage of the vast industrial city and the auto repair shop beneath the apartment he lived. Watch the video below and post your opinion in the comments box below.

The album has 14 tracks, with a deluxe version boasting another 3 bonus tracks.

  • The Next Day
  • Dirty Boys
  • The Stars (Are Out Tonight)
  • Love Is Lost
  • Where Are We Now?
  • Valentine’s Day
  • If You Can See Me
  • I’d Rather Be High
  • Boss of Me
  • Dancing Out In Space
  • How Does the Grass Grow?
  • (You Will) Set the World on Fire
  • You Feel So Lonely You Could Die
  • Heat
  • So She (Bonus Track)
  • I’ll Take You There (Bonus Track)
  • Plan (Bonus Track)

Visit Bowie’s official site for more information; DavidBowie.com
